qas.question: In 2014, what percentage of the city identified as Christian?
In 2014, what percentage of the city identified as Protestant?
In 2014, what percent of the City of Boston was Catholic?
In 2014, what percentage of Bostons residents did not claim to belong to any religion?
In 2014, other religions mad eup what percentage of the citys population?

context: According to a 2014 study by the Pew Research Center, <a0_0>57%<a0_0/> of the population of the city identified themselves as Christians, with <a1_0>25%<a1_0/> professing attendance at a variety of churches that could be considered Protestant, and <a2_0>29%<a2_0/> professing Roman Catholic beliefs. while <a3_0>33%<a3_0/> claim no religious affiliation. The same study says that other religions (including Judaism, Buddhism, Islam, and Hinduism) collectively make up about <a4_0>10%<a4_0/> of the population.
